content: Hi, you're right of course, I only need the packaged theorems and not the implementation details. Relying on implementation would be a bad idea either way. In this case, I was looking for lt_iff_le_not_le that comes with real.linear_order. Thanks!
Bart Michels has marked this topic as resolved.

Ruben Van de Velde said:

For some reason the lt definition is private - it's a few lines up in the source

Unless you have some really complicated definition for which it's impossible to provide a concise API, making these definitions that only exist to be put in instances private tends to be a good idea.
